name: Arthur O. ARMSTRONG, Petitioner, v. UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR the EASTERN DISTRICT OF PENNSYLVANIA.
name_abbreviation: Armstrong v. U.S. Dist. Court for the E. Dist. of Pa.

court.name: Supreme Court of the United States

parties:
Arthur O. ARMSTRONG, Petitioner,
v.
UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR the EASTERN DISTRICT OF PENNSYLVANIA.
attorneys: Motion of petitioner for leave to proceed in forma pauperis denied, and petition for a writ of certiorari to the United States Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit dismissed. See Rule 39.8. As petitioner has repeatedly abused this Court's process, the Clerk is directed not to accept any further petitions in noncriminal matters from petitioner unless the docketing fee required by Rule 38(a) is paid and petition submitted in compliance with Rule 33.1. See Martin v. District of Columbia Court of Appeals , 506 U.S. 1, 113 S.Ct. 397, 121 L.Ed.2d 305 (1992) (per curiam ).
casebody.head_matter:
Arthur O. ARMSTRONG, Petitioner,
v.
UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR the EASTERN DISTRICT OF PENNSYLVANIA.
No. 19-5213
Supreme Court of the United States.
October 7, 2019
Motion of petitioner for leave to proceed in forma pauperis denied, and petition for a writ of certiorari to the United States Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit dismissed. See Rule 39.8. As petitioner has repeatedly abused this Court's process, the Clerk is directed not to accept any further petitions in noncriminal matters from petitioner unless the docketing fee required by Rule 38(a) is paid and petition submitted in compliance with Rule 33.1. See Martin v. District of Columbia Court of Appeals , 506 U.S. 1, 113 S.Ct. 397, 121 L.Ed.2d 305 (1992) (per curiam ).
Justice Alito took no part in the consideration or decision of this motion and this petition.
